feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Dense Fog Advisory issued August 20 at 5:02PM AKDT until August 21 at 7:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Visibility one quarter mile or less in dense fog. * WHERE...Sitka. * WHEN...Until 7 AM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to low visibility.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 3:14PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued August 20 at 1:25PM AKDT until August 21 at 5:00AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...South winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * WHERE...Near Donnelly Dome. * WHEN...Until 5 AM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects.

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 20 at 1:07PM SST by NWS
entry.summary: ...A High Surf Advisory remains in effect... * WHAT...Surf of 10 to 13 feet. * WHERE...South and east facing shores of all islands. * WHEN...through Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor. Expect some strong breaking waves, shorebreak, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 20 at 11:10PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG OVERNIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING... Satellite products and surface observations show patchy fog developing across southern Rhode Island and south coastal Massachusetts. Patchy dense fog is possible overnight through early Sunday morning with visibility less than half a mile.
